text_block_list.name: Curren Chan
text_block_list.text:
Why'd you call me out here so early,<n>Yukino? You have a
way different look<n>on your face than yesterday.

text_block_list.name: Yukino Bijin
text_block_list.text: Curren, I'm sorry for say'n such a<n>silly thing yesterday!

text_block_list.name: Yukino Bijin
text_block_list.text:
I'll do it! The highlight of the song. I'll<n>dance to it right in the
middle! But I'm<n>gonna need a lot more practice b'fore<n>I'm
ready...

text_block_list.name: Yukino Bijin
text_block_list.text: Please! Teach me how t'dance!

text_block_list.name: Curren Chan
text_block_list.text: Hehe! Sure. â™ª Now I know how to<n>dance your part, so...

text_block_list.name: Curren Chan
text_block_list.text: I'll teach you how to make it look<n>super-duper cute!

text_block_list.name: Yukino Bijin
text_block_list.text:
Curren... I really 'preciate it! I'll pull<n>out all the stops t'make
this dance<n>perfect!

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: ...Oh? So she does have instincts.<n>That's more like it.

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text:
Just have fun, Brian. That goes for<n>this festival, the
Fleetfoot Festival, and<n>the archery show with me.

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text: That's all I wish for you.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text:
Hmph... This training's stolen enough<n>of my time as it is. All
it's doing is<n>making me hunger for the racecourse<n>even
more.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text:
(Complaining from inside my cage is<n>getting boring too. A
beast would tear<n>through it with their teeth and run<n>wild.)

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text:
Fine then... I'll have fun all right, in a<n>way that suits me.
Time to unleash my<n>instincts.

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text:
Oh, Brian. Here for a morning bath? It<n>is, regrettably, the last
day of our trip,<n>after all.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text:
I just came to talk to you. I figured<n>you'd come here to
wake yourself up,<n>and here you are.

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text:
Haha. There are regular students on<n>this trip with us, Brian.
I'd appreciate if<n>you didn't reference my habit of<n>
oversleeping for the sake of my<n>appearance.

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text: But I digress. What did you want to<n>discuss?

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: The archery show.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text:
It's too boring to just follow the<n>watered-down version of
the event.<n>The audience must be bored of it by<n>now too.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text:
If we're going to do this, why not do<n>it the original way,
"Emperor?"

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text: Oho...

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text:
You said it, didn't you? The ritual<n>used to be performed
across the<n>whole sacred mountain.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text:
The archers would shoot countless<n>targets, running and
leaping around<n>the mountain in unforgiving natural<n>
conditions.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text:
There's more to it. The object was to<n>reach the peak of the
mountain before<n>the bonfire goes out, but the two<n>archers
also competed to see who<n>shoots the most targets.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text:
You proudly said to the director you'd<n>make this year's
Fleetfoot Festival "a<n>success like none other," remember?

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text:
So you're saying that in terms of both<n>novelty and
entertainment, the original<n>format is better? Hehe. Indeed
that is<n>a well-reasoned argument.

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text: It almost doesn't sound like you.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: ...Huh?

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text:
You've shown me your power of<n>persuasion, I require no
more<n>convincing, Brian. I just want to know<n>one thing.

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text: Will you enjoy doing it that way?

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: Hah.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text:
What a stupid question. Join me for a<n>real hunt, Emperor.
That's what our<n>Goddesses would want, don't you<n>
think?

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: I follow my instincts, and my instinctswant real prey!

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text:
So the beast is finally bearing its<n>fangs. That's what I like to
hear from<n>you, Brian.

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text:
It goes without saying that I accept<n>the proposal. We should
proceed with<n>haste. Since we're here, shall we<n>continue
the discussion in the sauna?

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: What, you want to warm up with a<n>test of endurance?

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text: Haha! With you, Brian, that's not<n>such a bad idea!
